anncad module¶

class anncad.AnncadClassifier(threshold, batch_size, attributes_boundaries, hypercubes_number=None)¶

Bases: object

Class providing methods for user to create and use the classifier.

Parameters:
  • threshold – When difference between cardinalities of two most frequent classes divided by sum of them is greater than threshold, we assign the most frequent class.
  • batch_size – Minimum number of Examples that triggers Update method.
  • attributes_boundaries – A list of tuples, each consisting of min and max values of the attribute.
  • hypercubes_number (integer or None) – Number of hypercubes in the BasicGrid. Default value: 2^(number of Example’s attributes).
Raises:

ValueError – When threshold, batch_size or hypercubes_number are not convertible to numeric types.
add_examples(list_of_examples)¶

Adds all of the provided Examples to BasicGrid.

Parameters:list_of_examples – A list of Examples.
batch_update()¶

Checks if the number of Examples in the example_queue is sufficient and updates the grids.

check_if_proper_example_coordinates(coordinates)¶

Checks if the list of coordinates contains only numeric values, has adequate length and if all of the provided values are within the attributes boundaries.

Parameters:coordinates – A list of coordinates.
Returns:True if the list meets all of the conditions, otherwise False.
classify(example_coords)¶

Given a list of coordinates, classifies the observation.

Parameters:example_coords – Coordinates of the observation.
Returns:Class id.
set_hypercubes_classes()¶

Sets all of the BasicGrid’s Hypercubes classes.

test(example)¶

Given a list of coordinates and a class id at the last index, creates an Example object and classifies it.

Parameters:example – A list of coordinates and a class id at the last index.
Returns:Class id.
update(list_of_examples)¶

Adds the Examples to the example_queue.

Parameters:list_of_examples – A list of new Examples.
